com.garmin.android.connectiq

Class ConnectIQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.garmin.android.connectiq.ConnectIQ
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectIQAdbStrategy, ConnectIQDeviceStrategy

    public abstract class ConnectIQ

extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the primary interface for the Connect IQ mobile SDK. All interactions with the SDK and Connect IQ devices is done using this class. This is an abstract class but is not intended to be extended by developers. It is abstract so that different communication protocols can be added without requiring the need to utilize a completely different class by protocol. To get an instance of this class the caller should first call getInstance(IQCommProtocol) to create and get an instance of this object for a given protocol. Subsequent calls to retrieve an instance of this object should use getInstance() with no additional parameters.

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ConnectIQ.ConnectIQListener
      Interface for receiving callbacks from various asynchronous API calls related to SDK initialization.
      static interface  ConnectIQ.IQApplicationEventListener
      Interface for receiving callbacks related to a specific application on a specific device.
      static interface  ConnectIQ.IQApplicationInfoListener
      Interface for receiving callback related to getApplicationInfo requests.
      static class  ConnectIQ.IQConnectType
      Enumeration identifying the various connection types supported by the SDK
      static interface  ConnectIQ.IQDeviceEventListener
      Interface for receiving callbacks related to a specific device.
      static class  ConnectIQ.IQMessageStatus
      Enumeration returned from sendMessage() or provided when a message is received from a Connect IQ device.
      static class  ConnectIQ.IQSdkErrorStatus
      Enumeration of values returned from initialize()
      static interface  ConnectIQ.IQSendImageListener 
      static interface  ConnectIQ.IQSendMessageListener
      Interface for receiving callbacks when sending a message or image to a Connect IQ device.

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String APPLICATION_INFO
      Action for listening for application info responses

      Action for listening for device status changes.

      Extra passed with the APPLICATION_INFO action providing information regarding the specific application id
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_APPLICATION_VERSION
      Extra passed with the APPLICATION_INFO action providing version information for the installed application Values < 0 represent that an application is not currently installed.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_PAYLOAD
      Extra passed in the broadcast intent for incoming messages that contains a list of object representing the data passed from the remote device.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_REMOTE_APPLICATION
      Extra passed in the broadcast intent for incoming/outgoing messages identifying the remote application that is sending this message.

      Extra passed in the broadcast intent for incoming/outgoing messages or device status identifying the remote device.

      Extra passed with the DEVICE_STATUS action providing the current status for the device.

      Action for listening for incoming messages.

      Action for listening for status update when sending messages

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ConnectIQ getInstance()
        Retrieve an instance of ConnectIQ based upon the current connection type that is set. Note that if this method is called before calling getInstance(IQCommProtocol) version that the currently set protocol will be used. To get an instance of ConnectIQ for a specific protocol, use getInstance(IQCommProtocol) version.
        Returns:
        Instance of ConnectIQ for the currently set protocol.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getInstance

        public static ConnectIQ getInstance(Context context,

                    ConnectIQ.IQConnectType connectType)
        Retrieve an instance of ConnectIQ for the specified connection type. ConnectIQ can only use one connection type at a time so if an instance of ConnectIQ was previously retrieved for a different connection type, that instance will be shut down and a new instance created.
        Parameters:
        connectType - Type of connection to use with ConnectIQ
        Returns:
        Instance of a ConnectIQ object for use with the specified connection type
        Since:
        1.0

      • setAdbPort

        public void setAdbPort(int port)

                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Utility method to set the port used when creating a connection to the Connect IQ simulator over ADB
        Parameters:
        port - Port to use. The client PC must issue the command "adb forward tcp: tcp:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the port number passed in not between 1025 - 65535
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAdbPort

        public int getAdbPort()
        Returns the current port being used when creating a connection to the Connect IQ simulator over ADB
        Returns:
        Port number being used.
        Since:
        1.0

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Context context,

              boolean autoUI,

              ConnectIQ.ConnectIQListener listener)
        Initializes the Connect IQ environment. This call is required before attempting to make calls to any other API. This method will check to see if Garmin Connect Mobile is installed and if not and the autoUI flag is true, it will display a message to the user that they need to install Garmin Connect Mobile and provide a direct link to the Google Play Store to let them install it.
        Parameters:
        context - Context for the application. Since this is a singleton, it is best to use the application context vs an activity context.
        autoUI - Display a UI to the user letting them know they need to install Garmin Connect Mobile if it is not installed.
        listener - Callback listener to be notified of the status of the sdk initialization.
        Since:
        1.0

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown(Context context)

              throws InvalidStateException
        Let the SDK know that the application no longer will be calling any of its services so it can free any resources. if when initializing the sdk a ConnectIQListener was passed, the listener will be notified of the success of this through onSdkShutDown();
        Parameters:
        context - Context for the application. Since this is a singleton, it is best to use the application context vs an activity context.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException
        Since:
        1.0

      • getConnectedDevices

        public abstract java.util.List<IQDevice> getConnectedDevices()

                                                      throws InvalidStateException,

                                                             ServiceUnavailableException
        Returns a list of Connect IQ compatible devices currently connected to Garmin Connect Mobile that can be communicated with via the SDK.
        Returns:
        Connected devices that can be sent messages.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException - Either initialize() has not been called or the remote connection has become invalid.
        ServiceUnavailableException - Either the remote service is unavailable or Garmin Connect Mobile is not installed, or it is the wrong version.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getKnownDevices

        public abstract java.util.List<IQDevice> getKnownDevices()

                                                  throws InvalidStateException,

                                                         ServiceUnavailableException
        Returns a list of currently paired within Garmin Connect Mobile but not necessarily connected Connect IQ compatible devices. getDeviceStatus() will need to be called for each device to determine it's current status.
        Returns:
        Devices that are paired within Garmin Connect Mobile.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException - Either initialize() has not been called or the remote connection has become invalid.
        ServiceUnavailableException - Either the remote service is unavailable or Garmin Connect Mobile is not installed, or it is the wrong version.
        Since:
        1.0

      • registerForEvents

        public void registerForEvents(IQDevice device,

                     ConnectIQ.IQDeviceEventListener listener,

                     IQApp app,

                     ConnectIQ.IQApplicationEventListener applistener)

                       throws InvalidStateException
        Register for both device and application events. Convenience method vs. calling registerForDeviceEvents() and registerForApplicationEvents() when only interested in a single application on a Connect IQ device. See registerForDeviceEvents(IQDevice, IQDeviceEventListener) See #registerForApplicationEvents(IQDevice, IQApp, IQApplicationEventListener)
        Parameters:
        device - IQDevice to register to receive events for.
        listener - IQDeviceEventListener that will receive device event notifications.
        app - IQApp to register to receive events for.
        applistener - IQApplicationEventListener that wil receive application event notifications.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ConnectIQ.IQDeviceEventListener, ConnectIQ.IQApplicationEventListener

      • unregisterForDeviceEvents

        public void unregisterForDeviceEvents(IQDevice device)

                               throws InvalidStateException
        Unregister for only device events for the specific Connect IQ device. If previously registered for application event, those events are not affected by this method.
        Parameters:
        device - IQDevice to remove device event registration for.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException
        Since:
        1.0

                                  IQApp application)

                                    throws InvalidStateException
        Unregister for application events for the specific IQDevice, IQApp combination.
        Parameters:
        device - IQDevice to unregister the application event notifications for.
        application - IQApp to unregister application event notifications for.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException
        Since:
        1.0

      • openStore

        public boolean openStore(IQApp application)

                  throws InvalidStateException,

                         ServiceUnavailableException
        Will open the Connect IQ Store within Garmin Connect Mobile and display the details for the application specified by applicationID. If null, the store will be opened to the main store page.
        Parameters:
        application - - Application to display the details for, or null.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException
        ServiceUnavailableException
        Since:
        1.0

      • getDeviceStatus

        public abstract IQDevice.IQDeviceStatus getDeviceStatus(IQDevice device)

                                                 throws InvalidStateException,

                                                        ServiceUnavailableException
        Retrieve the status of a specific remote device.
        Parameters:
        device - RemoteDevice to retrieve the status for.
        Returns:
        Will return the current status of the device as one of the following: CONNECTED - The device is connected and can be communicated with. NOT_CONNECTED - The device is paired, but is not currently connected and cannot be communicated with. NOT_PAIRED - The device is not currently paired with Garmin Connect Mobile, the user will need to pair their device within Garmin Connect Mobile. UNKNOWN - The ConnectIQ Service returned a state that is not recognized by this version of the SDK.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException - Either initialize() has not been called or the remote connection has become invalid.
        ServiceUnavailableException - A remote exception was received when attempting to communicate with the ConnectIQ Service.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getApplicationInfo

        public void getApplicationInfo(java.lang.String applicationId,

                      IQDevice device,

                      ConnectIQ.IQApplicationInfoListener listener)

                        throws InvalidStateException,

                               ServiceUnavailableException
        Inquires the specific device regarding the passed application to determine if it is indeed installed on the device. If it is not installed additional information will be returned to let the developer know if it is supported or not on the particular device.
        Parameters:
        device - Device to check to see if the application is installed on.
        applicationId - Id of the application to check.
        listener - IQApplicationListener to receive application information.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException
        ServiceUnavailableException
        Since:
        1.0

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(IQDevice device,

               IQApp application,

               java.lang.Object javaObject,

               ConnectIQ.IQSendMessageListener listener)

                 throws InvalidStateException,

                        ServiceUnavailableException
        Send a Connect IQ formatted message to the specific device.
        Parameters:
        device - Device to send the message to.
        application - Application to send the message to.
        data - A single java object to send to the device. The following java types are valid for this parameter. Integer, Float, String, List, Boolean, HashMap List and HashMaps must contain only objects of the above types.
        listener - Callback listener to receive notifications of when the message has been sent.
        Throws:
        InvalidStateException - Either initialize() has not been called or the remote connection has become invalid.
        ServiceUnavailableException
        Since:
        1.0
